label: 政所
本: A Tale of Flowering Fortunes:  Annals of Japanese Aristocratic Life in the Heian Period (Volumes One and Two) . Stanford University Press . 1980
説明文: Quasi-official and private administrative organs.... The most important organ in a regental or kugyō household (sekkan kugyō no keishi) was the Mandokoro, or Administrative Office, which administered the family's affairs, including its all-important relations with the field officials in charge of its provinicial sources of income. It worked under the direction of a Superintendent (Bettō), aided by lesser officials known as Rei, Chikaji, Anju, and so forth.... A regent's wife presided over her own Mandokoro. [公卿、摂関公卿の家司、別当、令、案主、知家事]
